attributes.comment:
There is a proposal to increase the fees for filing form I-600 and the FBI
fingerprinting that is required for inter-country adoptions. As an adoptive parent
who is in the midst of this process, I request these fees NOT be increased. The
entire adoption process is extremely expensive and increasing these fees adds
insult to injury. Please make steps to make it easier to adoption orphaned
abandoned children--not more difficult and costly. Currently the regulations have
the I-600 form expire after 18 months and the FBI fingerprints expire after 15
months. The adoption process is often LONGER than these timelines. Therefore
as adoptive parents we have to file the I-600 and the FBI fingerprints AGAIN--along
with paying those fees AGAIN. Please lengthen the expiration dates on these
pieces of paper. These expiration dates set at 18 months and 15 months are
probably arbitrary times. I haven't found any employee who could explain why
those expiration dates were set for those times. Please, make adoption less
paper-trail cumbersome. Thank you for listening to my heart-felt plea.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Sonda L. Hansen
